item.title: stock market: allocation and frequency — 14 replies — 43.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
stock market: allocation and frequency

Open thread • Replies: 14 • Updated: 2026-02-17 15:13 UTC

OP

Am I insane foe wanting to invest in 50 different comapnies and 3 ETFs? Am I overdoing it? Or should i just choose sector ETFs instead of companies to reduce my list.

Also how often should I invest per year to reduce overall commission costs? Quarterly? Is there a way on IBKR to place a basket order so I only pay for one trade across multiple stocks?

Early replies (first 3)

61862142
50 is too much, portfolio theory says around 20-30 before it's not worth it and I would lean towards the smaller number

61862144
>>61862099
In general it's better to bet on something broader than something more specific. As long as the sector grows you'll grow but a company can easily fail even if the product or the sector is wanted. When I was younger I invested in Nikola because I thought I would be hedging against Tesla. Turns out the company was a mess and people don't care that they're sucked dry by Elon. I still believe EVs will be more important for long haul and business use.

61862220
>>61862144
>I invested in Nikola because I thought I would be hedging against Tesla. Turns out the company was a mess and people don't care that they're sucked dry by Elon
you thought the ceo who would go on to lead tsla to a 20x was sucking they company dry so instead you put your money into an obvious scam whose CEO would go on to be arrested for securities and wire fraud? Where do you do your research, the daily show???

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61862273
Translation:
>PLEASE GOD STOP DUMPING MICROSOFT AHHHHHHHH

61862287
>>61862142
Why?

61862313
>>61862099
https://investcalc.github.io/

61862329
>>61862220
>you thought the ceo who would go on to lead tsla to a 20x was sucking they company dry
No stop trying to twist the words on my screen. Elon is milking his customer base and its obvious and apparent to everyone. I thought people would notice that and move to a better car manufacturer.
>whose CEO would go on to be arrested for securities and wire fraud?
Hindsight is 20/20
>Where do you do your research, the daily show???
I invested long before any of the scandals came to be and the focus on long haul makes sense for as long as we don't have a sufficient hydrogen infrastructure.

61862353
>>61862099
Can he take one picture where he doesn't look like a slimeball piece of shit? Just one.

61862425
>>61862287
MPT claims you can only diversify away idiosyncratic (company specific) risk, and at some point you have so many different companies and exposure to so many different sectors that adding another company doesn't reduce risk by much if at all. I think markowitz or sharpe has a mathematical proof on it out there somewhere. Apparently they say that number is around 20-30
I say lean towards less because you have to take into consideration transaction costs and time and energy spent reorganizing your portfolio and tracking your positions as well. If you're just an average person and not a portfolio manager getting paid you're probably just fine with 12-15

61862458
>>61862099
the idea of diversifying is reducing the volatility of your portfolio value, if you want to do it properly you should study the correlations between your picks, this has a cost of reducing the potential gains but they become more steady. For example if you pick 50 tech companies and etfs and the ai bubble bursts, the stocks are so highly correlated between them that all of them would go down at the same time and diversifying would be useless, even if between your picks you picked the one tech company that survives

61864023
My strategy was to invest in a new company every month
Guess I'm retarded...

61864325
>>61864023
>The average diversified portfolio holds between 20 and 30 stocks, but could have even more. The Motley Fool's position is that investors should own 25 or more different stocks. Diversifying your portfolio in the stock market is a good idea for investors because it decreases risk by ensuring that no single company has too much influence over the value of your holdings.

61864389
>>61862099
You will have the slowest and most ass returns.
Only do this if you are interested in your retirement situation.

61865302
>>61862099
I have over 200 stocks and about a dozen etfs. I have the stocks because I enjoy looking at all the little dividend payments. I am also beating the market so there is that. Sometimes one of my picks does a 10x and that makes up for the ones that -50%

item.title: Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop?? — 7 replies — 20.5/hr
item.content:encoded:
Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop??

Open thread • Replies: 7 • Updated: 2026-02-17 15:12 UTC

OP

Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop??

Early replies (first 3)

61864202
LinkedIn is complete dogshit so I guess not.

61864249
>>61864195
I got my job off a posting on Handshake

61864299
>>61864195
I honestly don't believe anyone is getting jobs on linkedin anymore. Nobody.
I tried almost 2 years and sent hundreds upon hundreds of applications.
Fake jobs.
AI fake recruiters.
All bullshit man.
I got my job off a local job board finally.
LinkedIn has only one use to find you a job: post to your hundreds of connections asking if anyone can refer you to a job. It's a networking site.
I add the maximum number of connections every week in my industry targeted at companies I might want to work for in the future.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61864306
>>61864195
LinkedIn is full of indians

61865108
>>61864249
handshake.firm

61865182
Believe it or not, careerbuilder. it’s jam packed with indians but once a week I got a good lead from a mag7 recruiter and one of them hired me

61865294
>>61864195
80% of job openings are fake and just HRM wasting everyone's time.
19.999999% of jobs go to nepo hire scum, so you never had a chance anyways.

>No, we just despise you nerva shills. ... And then you just all seem to bring up, out of nowhere and completely unrelated of course, the solution which is an unmaintained jeetcoin with a ring size less than 1/3 of Monero's ring size and none of the development Monero received since 2018

Cant fucking follow a conversation worth shit, you dumb bot code gets so mixed up between threads you think everyone is a nervjeet or whatever the fucking you keep going on about.
>Says someone defending the literal jeetcoin, how ironic.
Niggerbot who brings up nerva in every thread he spams to(<- thats you, no one mentions nerva BUT you)

>>61862129

>>61861976
actually kind of funny, didnt even notice my id

61862475
>>61849447
How do I buy Monero without leaving a KYC trace?

I can't buy XMR directly on exchanges (UK). If I buy BTC -> the tax man can see I have BTC and will expect to see a "sell" at some point.

Tried Bisq, but hardly any sellers and also a risk of your bank account getting flagged / closed if the person is dodgy.

61862494
>>61862460
>the bot wouId show.
How come you didn't know this when I posted >>61849898? Maybe you need to refine your instincts or could it be that all of your anti-Monero arguments are moot so you try to attack me? >>61862460
>Cant fucking follow a conversation worth shit,

>Niggerbot who brings up nerva in every thread he spams to(<- thats you, no one mentions nerva BUT you)

61862530
>>61849447
Monero is the only privacy coin.

Any other digital asset is traceable.

You have 1 (one) more opportunity for an early Bitcoin moment.

Monero will be the world currency of the 2030s and beyond.

61862538
>steals pic that is interesting from nervjeet
>stolen image literally has the fucking fileneame from the post it came from
>this bot thinks im the same guy
>his nonsensical bot reply gives him away within a few posts because it always handles the same
Report this fucker, if he doesnt get banned, all the more reason to NOT trust monero or anyone pushing monero, because the bot is being run from 4chan itself.

on the XMR thread, this is the same bot>>61860201 DXIC7i+b
it just goes on and on. hope real anons find this post and start to question wtf is going on around here.

61862542
>>61862475
Do you have Revolut?

Use it on Hodlhodl (trade escrow service)
Send it to some BTC wallet (Sparrow)
Use Trocador to convert it to XMR

61862551
>>61859002
Privacy is basically impossible to do for smart contracts outside of creating a specific app such as Tornado. When you create specific apps such as Tornado, you make it extremely vulnerable to censorship from the government, like happened to Tornado. Even though the lawsuit was "dropped", activity on Tornado is basically nonexistent because nobody trusts it anymore. They shouldn't. Likewise, nobody should ever trust a "privacy app" on top of a public L1.

And don't get me started on how ridiculous a "privacy L2" would be on top of a public L1.

If you want privacy, you start at the L1 layer.
If you want privacy, you choose Monero.

61862566
>>61862538
>>this bot thinks im the same guy
No, I think you're a nerva shill that tries to play stupid and make this about BTC (it never was) and me being bad because I expose your stupidity.

item.title: What the fuck is the deal with PTO — 23 replies — 92.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
What the fuck is the deal with PTO

Open thread • Replies: 23 • Updated: 2026-02-17 15:29 UTC

OP

So I've only worked one white collar job my whole life, and we would always just book our vacations in advance, we were given 5 weeks of vacation every year and we would just tell them what days we want off.
Now I'm going into this new corporate job and they're saying I have to earn my vacations? And earn my holidays? Wtf is this shit. How giving fast do I earn these good boy vacation days. THIS IS FUCKING RETARDED

Early replies (first 3)

61860924
>>61860903
they expect you to work like a jeet, congratulations thanks for playing

61860942
>>61860903
5 weeks of vacation is 200 hours. you earn 16.67 hours a month. some places let you take vacation as you want and only make a big deal if you quit or run deep into the negatives. other, shittier places make no exceptions.

61860971
>>61860903
>be me
>want to take vacation
>no accrual (though technically I could probably owe them money if I took 4 weeks in January and then quit)
>put it on my calendar
>don't check with nobody
>not even logged with the timesheet accounting
>day comes
>set email responder
This is why I'm hesitant to look for a new job.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61860987
>>61860924
Basically this
Corporate got filled with low trust taskmasters in the wake of flooding every major urban area with low trust resource sinks
The only solution at this point is a parallel economy that turns into a (non official because oy vey) parallel state apparatus.
We have the resources to do this now, but no coherent culture to nucleate around

61860994
>wah my boss won't pay for me to not work

61861001
>>61860987
So you're saying that the quality of the employee went down, that's the quality of their supervisors went down, thus trust was lost in the old fashioned system like I had in my first job is the way the dinosaur now and it's probably is very rare to have a job where you can just get a set amount of vacation per year without earning it?

61861025
>>61860903
I worked at a tech company with unlimited PTO, and barely anyone actually took time off. I always felt weird taking sick days or whatever because all of my coworkers were workaholics.

61861031
>>61861025
"unlimited PTO" means you just get fired without warning if you take time off

61861033
>>61861001
Yes, that's basically it
Blame every single policymaker and adherent to "multiculturalism." Many cultures on the planet are in no way bad, even sampled within one area, but there are ZERO instances of long term multiculturalism without major strife, war, and civilizational/societal degradation. Homogeneous cultures, planted at the root of the psyche, are the one guaranteed pathway to the success of the human macroorganism

61861082
>>61860903
The thing that pisses me off about PTO is that I'm unable to take UPTO. Sure, give me a certain amount of paid days off but if I want to take unpaid days off I should be able to have as many as I want. Fuck you.

61861089
>>61861082
That too. I might not have made a profit while self employed, but these white collar mind games suck

61861115
>>61861082
That would mean your job is so expendable that they can allow you to just leave and come back as you please without having any significant impact on business operations. In which case they might as well just replace you.

61861197
Thinly veiled data-mining thread

Thinly vailed ragebait thread

OP is/will always be a cuck

61861198
>>61860903
If you signed, it's your fault anon. Next time be ready to do a 360 on the spot if you don't like the contract

61861502
>>61861115
Kind of, but also not really...I work in admin in the life insurance & personal finance industry, if I've shown myself to be dependable come crunch time, am able to develop processes to make sure cases are compliant, basically keep shit in order, it's way more expensive to attempt to hire new and retrain (not to mention re-certify new hires if they come in unlicensed) and re-vet potential new hires. Just because I do all this doesn't mean I shouldn't be able to take as much time off as I want when it's a slow period, or I'm able to find someone else to cover while I'm away, you know?

61861533
>>61860903
Yeah I had to work for 2 years with no days off to earn enough PTO to take two weeks off at one job. If you called in they took a PTO day away and gave you a point. 7 points and it was automatic termination.

61861543
earn means time in this case
this is so you can't take you 5 weeks on day one and then quit after that

61863592
>>61861502
No, exactly really. If you're completely optional, then you're completely unneeded.

61864938
>>61860903
youd be surprised at how badly niggers abuserd the system in large corpos so they cracked down.
Just another perk of life ruined by fucking niggers

61864971
I get 28 days off guaranteed every year and nobody "abuses" the system, lmao mutts will suck cock and say its le efficient or fair I hope your cancer country gets nuked cya

61865006
>>61860903
Just say you have covid and complications with COVID. Buy an old positive test, go to the doctor and get a note. Boom your off for a few days

61865036
>>61860903
>Now I'm going into this new corporate job and they're saying I have to earn my vacations? And earn my holidays? Wtf is this shit. How giving fast do I earn these good boy vacation days. THIS IS FUCKING RETARDED

Loads of jobs have people show up and quit or suck ass and need to be fired. Handing people five weeks they can take day 1 on the job is silly.

So instead they'll make you work X months and then only award 1 day per 2 weeks or whatever. You still earn 5 weeks off a year but then you just haven't gotten it all to blow

61865426
I started taking an hour of leave every day because i couldnt do 9 hours a day in the office and wanted to go to the gym before it was pitch dark outside and i got called in by my 3 supervisors and HR and counselling asking if i was suicidal.

item.title: The US is in recession — 82 replies — 83.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
The US is in recession

Open thread • Replies: 82 • Updated: 2026-02-17 14:33 UTC

OP

The US is in recession

Early replies (first 3)

61857499
White collar recession comes before regular recession 100% of the time. We've been in a white collar recession since 2020.

61857500
>>61857490
Always was, its depression for over a year now.

61857508
>>61857490
GDP is growing, recession is fake.

Nothing ever happens.

Stop putting your vibes and feelings into your job search, learn to get better skills and be more marketable to employers.

McDonalds is always hiring

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61860619
>>61859951
>Get America back up to 70%+ White, fix your money printing problem, deal with the israel problem in your government, and the economy will take care of itself.
anything else while we have the magic wand out sir?

61860705
>>61859951
>How the fuck do you reach the conclusion that America needs an "international order" to function when it's downfall has correlated perfectly to its kowtowing to international interests
What international interests? The US has been profiting off the international order since Breton Woods. Its rise as a superpower correlates to the dollar’s international dominance. It’s the opposite of what you’re describing.
>America is almost entirely self-sufficient
It is completely dependent on foreign pharmaceuticals and various input goods for manufacturing. It has virtually no domestic source of lithium, cobalt, graphite or REMs.
>the problem is international Jewry and this will be rectified when the us becomes an autarky
Why?

The rotting elephant in the room is a declining dollar, obscene debt, and an overinflated market + made up statistics. None of this gets better by fucking up international trade.

61860719
>>61857750

US being in a recession isn't about Trump.
Yes he's a fucking retarded boomer brained moron, but US has been doomed to hit this point sooner or later ever since they decided to crank the money printers on permanently after 2008 and doomed the entire West to be stuck in a slow death limbo.
Everyone has basically just been waiting for the big one for years now and we're getting closer and closer to it.

61860738
>>61859951
You have no idea how the dollar system works and it shows. What's happening to the United States right now is irreversible

61860813
>>61860719
Printing after 2008 happened because 2008 happened, which happened because republicans deregulated finance. You're right, it's not about Trump, it's about half the country being fucking retarded hicks

61860867
>>61860813
Republicans like Raegan deregulated finance, that’s true (though some of that was put into motion by Jimmy Carter). That said, it’s impossible to talk about 2008 without recognizing that Clinton is the one who repealed the Glass-Steagall act and let insurance banking merge with commercial banking. Pretty much every president for the 30 years leading up to 2008 did something to enable it or make it worse.

61860880
>>61860867
I forgot that Clinton was also the one that made derivatives immune to regulation. He really fucked up finance.

61860916
>>61857825
Holy shit this is the most retarded post I have ever read on /biz/, why are you on a finance board??

61860980
>>61860880
Clinton also forced banks to give mortgages to people with bad credit scores and low income

61861063
>>61857508

GDP was never meant to measure the health of the economy. Simon Kuznets advised against using it for that purpose.

61861445
>>61860705
>It has virtually no domestic source of lithium, cobalt, graphite or REMs.
There are actually fucking tons of sources, but none of them are developed because US companies exported the environmental cost of mining them to "dEvElOpInG" nations for cheaper labor/materials and most of the mines shut down because they couldn't compete. There are ludicrous amounts of these materials just sitting there in the US.

The US could be self-sufficient (example: fracking boom was because oil price had gotten to the point where domestic supply was economically viable again - in less than a decade the US had more oil than it could even use, because the oil was already in the ground, just not being extracted), but the profit motive won't allow self-sufficiency to persist if it's cheaper to import.

61861531
>>61861445
>”we are almost entirely self-sufficient”
>”ok we currently have no infrastructure to mine these resources”
Yes, exactly. We are totally dependent on foreign suppliers and as of right now we do not have a domestic source for these things. My point stands and yours is wrong. Coping about how we COULD have these things eventually doesn’t matter. Like it or not, the US is not self-sufficient, and it isn’t close. We import tremendous amounts of goods. Don’t even bother looking into pharmaceuticals because it will just depress you.

61861694
>>61857750
We've been in a recession since 2023. This isn't glorphf's fault or joepedo. Our economy is fake and gay made up of jewish daycare bullshit jobs. Soon it will all unravel.

61861711
>>61861531
Don't get your panties in a bunch, all I took issue with was saying "virtually no domestic source." Some people in these discussions act like SEA is the only place in the world that has minerals.

A water source is still there even if nobody builds a well. Since you seem to get that, you were probably looking for the phrase "domestic SUPPLY."

61861724
>>61857805

Oh no, its over, the Europeans and Anglos are mad we voted a republican again.

61861729
>>61858084
The fantasy is better than the reality

61861769
>>61857805
We should be bombing Mexico.

61861811
>>61861711
No I wasn’t. I don’t feel like explaining it to you so I’ll just let AI do it.

61863135
>>61858023

61863175

Nobody wants that shit yet it is going up with not only no buyers but countries constantly throwing it into the market. Absolute shitshow from a drowning in shit man.
Funny isn't it?

61863218
>>61860719

61863252

61863679

61864332

End of the Juglar cycle. Overproduction crisis. Fed interest rates plunging toward zero. Soon an other Capital idling necessary.

61864333

61864989
>>61863206
2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave

61865001
It really isn't mentioned enough that our "recovery" after 2008 was just setting interest rates to 0 for 10 years.

61865048
>>61864989
>...a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep...real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands....
You've laid out exactly what's been going on since 2008

61865068
>>61865048
yes thats the point, the implication here is that real estate is now permanently priced out of the middle class income range
not that a crash is imminent like the anon i was replying to seemed to suggest

item.content:encoded:
>mom yells at me for not having a job 5 months after I got laid off from my last one >Complains how we need more money t…

Open thread • Replies: 38 • Updated: 2026-02-17 13:46 UTC

OP

>mom yells at me for not having a job 5 months after I got laid off from my last one
>Complains how we need more money to pay the bills and how she can't keep working 10 hour shifts to pay our bills
>Look through her purse when she's not looking
>See a $600 receipt for perfume and makeup, and a bank note evidencing a $1800 transfer to her neet sister who also has 2 neet sons and a neet daughter.
>Dad gambled away another $10K in stocks.
>He keeps sending me job openings in other states/cities that require 10+ years of experience and he tells me "just walk up to them and ask them to train you, that's how we did it back in the old days"
>My own savings are slowly dwindling and I've got no more than a few months left before I'm officially broke
>800+ job apps and nothing yet
I'm not sure how much more of this I can take bros...
Why won't the economy get better?
Who do I blame for this miserable situation?
What are some easy painless ways to check out of this economy earlier don't speak?
Why are old people all so stupid and contemptible?
NGMI?

>a bank note evidencing a $1800 transfer to
>Dad gambled away another $10K in stocks
>Complains how we need more money to pay the bills
what came first?

It's been almost a few decades of smartphone development and auto correct still doesn't work properly yet AI fags are still like "we're totally gonna get agi and self driving cars this year bro!!!"

61864148
>>61863822
It really isn't. You can live VERY cheaply in a lot of Asian countries (Thailand, Laos, Indonesia) and do ridiculously low-paying remote work and still come out with net savings every month.

I worked in Taiwan (DON'T GO THERE) for a while and was able to save over 50% of my pay even though I made half as much as an American would make doing the same job (not ESLosering).

Wish I hadn't because it completely destroyed my health permanently (they're just as bad, maybe worse, about dumping toxic industrial chemicals in food as the mainland chinsects), but it was the only thing available to me after the 2008-12 crash during the Obamaconomy.
